title: Interrupts, IR Remote & Motor Control - Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of enums, interrupts, IRremote, and motor control in Arduino.

questions.question: What is an enum used for in Arduino?
options: To define a set of named constant values
To store a list of strings
questions.explanation: enum lets you create a list of named constants like IR_MODE or MUSIC_MODE.

questions.question: What does the volatile keyword indicate?
options: The variable may change unexpectedly, such as inside an interrupt
The variable stores floating point data
The variable is stored in EEPROM
questions.explanation: volatile prevents the compiler from optimizing out variables that change in interrupts.

questions.question: Which function attaches an interrupt to a specific pin?
questions.explanation: attachInterrupt() runs a function automatically when a pin changes state.

questions.question: What is debouncing in Arduino?
options: A method to speed up button response
A technique to filter electrical noise from analog sensors
A method to ignore multiple false button presses caused by mechanical bounce
A way to smooth PWM signals
questions.explanation: Debouncing prevents detecting multiple presses from one physical button press.

questions.question: Which function from the IRremote library checks if a signal has been received?
questions.explanation: IrReceiver.decode() returns true when a new IR signal is detected.

questions.question: Why is motor acceleration implemented gradually using a for-loop?
options: To prevent sudden jerks and reduce motor stress
questions.explanation: Gradually increasing PWM prevents sudden motor strain and smoother motion.

questions.question: Which pair of functions is used to generate and stop sound?
questions.explanation: tone() plays a sound at a given frequency, noTone() stops it.

questions.question: What parameter in attachInterrupt() specifies which pin to monitor?
questions.explanation: digitalPinToInterrupt(pin) converts a pin number into its interrupt number.

questions.question: What happens inside switch–case when the Forward IR code is received?
questions.explanation: When the Forward code is detected, switch–case calls moveForward().

questions.question: Why is lastInterruptTime used with DEBOUNCE_DELAY in toggleMode()?
options: To time how long the motor runs
To avoid reading the IR signal twice
To ensure enough time passes between button presses
questions.explanation: It checks that the time since the last interrupt exceeds the debounce delay, preventing repeated triggers.
